wikipedia_page.main: John William Gilbert, Baron Gilbert,  (5 April 1927 – 2 June 2013) was a British Labour politician.

response: * The Rt Hon John Gilbert, Baron Gilbert – life peer
*John Gilbert, Baron Gilbert (1927–2013), British Labour Party politician

It was opened on 24 May 1976 by John Gilbert, Baron Gilbert, the Minister of Transport. It was the last section of the main part of the M62 to open, comprising 109 miles. The M62 had taken 15 years and cost £190 million. The A63 Caves Bypass and M62 Balkholme sections (built by Clugston Construction) had opened on 19 February 1976. The Balkholme to Caves section was the first use on a UK motorway of continuously reinforced concrete pavement (CRCP), which has no transverse joints.
